result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andre Lafonte Liphford Jr

records.addlTxt: re: signature bond and bail jump & operating while revoked counts
Status conference on November 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

[ma] Cases 22CF405 and 22CF404 called at 9:02am [Scheduled for Preliminary Hearing, Officer is present]
Defendant Molly J Bellows appeared by phone.  Attorney Cassi Nelson in court for Molly J Bellows.  
Defendant Andre Lafonte Liphford Jr appears in court, in custody.
Attorney Michael Witt in court for State of Wisconsin. 

The Court reviews right to counsel with Mr. Liphford; Mr. Liphford asserts he still wishes to have counsel; The Court tolls time limits in Mr. Liphford's case. 
Atty Nelson indicates that Ms. Bellows intends to waive preliminary hearing.

recess: 9:06am 
NEXT: As to 22CF405, Bellows: Waiver of Prelim on 11/17/22 at 8:30am IN PERSON
As to 22CF404, Liphford: Status of Counsel on 11/17/22 at 8:30am

Pre-trial conference on September 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.

[MK] case called at 2:10pm
Defendant Andre Lafonte Liphford Jr appear via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Cassi Nelson (the PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 
The Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
Preliminary Hearing time limit is waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $10,000 Signature Bond with conditions:
--no contact with the Co-Defendant Molly J Bellows 
--no possession or use of controlled substances or prescription drugs without a valid prescription
--no possession of drug paraphernalia
recess 2:14pm. 

NEXT: (1) clerk- add the Jefferson Public Defender's Office to the mailing matrix, (2) Pretrial Conference on September 28th at 10:00am--case stacking with the co-defendant's case was approved by Attorney Flint (3) Preliminary Hearing on October 14th at 9:00am
Defendant has pending case assigned to Branch 1
